Karl Kurtz |choreographer= [[Irina Romanova (figure skater)|Irina Romanova]] |formerchoreographer= Nathan Birch |skating club= Washington FSC |currenttraininglocations = [[Wilmington, Virginia]] |formertraininglocations = |beganskating = 1997 |retired = |worldranking= '''31''' (''{{As of|2011|6|16}}'') |pbrankings = '''20''' (''[[2010â2011 figure skating season|2010â2011]]'')
'''42''' (''[[2009â2010 figure skating season|2009â2010]]'')
'''27''' (''[[2008â2009 figure skating season|2008â2009]]'') |combined total= 211.17 |combined date= [[2010 Skate America]] |SP score= 67.61 |SP date= [[2010 Skate America]] |FS score= 143.56 |FS date= [[2010 Skate America]] }} '''Armin Mahbanoozadeh''' (born August 15, 1991 in [[Alexandria, Virginia]]) is an [[United States|American]] [[figure skater]]. He is the [[2007 United States Figure Skating Championships|2007 US novice champion]]. He is the [[2008-2009 ISU Junior Grand Prix|2008 Junior Grand Prix Final silver medalist]] and [[2007-2008 ISU Junior Grand Prix|2007 Junior Grand Prix Final bronze medalist]]. == Career == Mahbanoozadeh won the bronze at the [[2007â2008 ISU Junior Grand Prix|2007â2008 Junior Grand Prix Final]] and silver at the [[2008â2009 Grand Prix of Figure Skating Final|2008â2009 Final]]. Mahbanoozadeh made his senior Grand Prix debut during the 2007â2008 season. He finished 9th at [[2009 Skate Canada]] and 11th at [[2009 Cup of China]]. At his first senior U.S. Nationals, he finished 8th. During the [[2010â2011 figure skating season|2010â2011 season]], Mahbanoozadeh placed 4th at [[2010 Nebelhorn Trophy]] and received one [[2010â11 ISU Grand Prix of Figure Skating|Grand Prix]] assignment, [[2010 Skate America]] where he won his first medal on the senior circuit. He was fourth after the short program and moved up to claim the bronze, edging out [[Adam Rippon]]. For the [[2011â2012 figure skating season|2011â2012 season]], Mahbanoozadeh began attempting a [[Quad (figure skating)|quad]] [[Toe loop jump|toe loop]] in competition. He is assigned to [[2011 Skate America]] and [[2011 NHK Trophy]] as his [[2011â12 ISU Grand Prix of Figure Skating|Grand Prix]] events. == Personal life == Mahbanoozadeh's surname means "born from a lady as beautiful as the moon" in [[Persian language|Persian]]. He graduated from [[Langley High School (Fairfax County, Virginia)|Langley High School]] in 2009 and was accepted to [[Dartmouth College]] but ultimately had to give up his spot because it would be impossible to combine competitive skating with studying at such a university. == Programs == {|class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" |- !
